flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: The primary arms attach the cylinder/frame assembly to the secondary arms, which support it. They also attach to the Brickholder plate, the Dirt-keeper plate, the Controller Mount, and the Valve Mount.
guide.introduction_rendered: The primary arms attach the cylinder/frame assembly to the secondary arms, which support it. They also attach to the Brickholder plate, the Dirt-keeper plate, the Controller Mount, and the Valve Mount.

lines.text: On one piece, mark holes on the 4" side, all 1.25" away from the edge for:
lines.text_raw: On one piece, mark holes on the 4" side, all 1.25" away from the edge for:

lines.text: Two total 3/4” diameter holes at 2” and 70.”
lines.text_raw: Two total 3/4” diameter holes at 2” and 70.”

lines.text: Six total 13/16” diameter holes at 27", 37", 39 3/4", 48 1/4", 51", and 63 1/2".
lines.text_raw: Six total 13/16” diameter holes at 27", 37", 39 3/4", 48 1/4", 51", and 63 1/2".

lines.text: Use this piece to mark the locations on the other side. They are to be mirrored, so make sure they aren't in the same exact orientation.
lines.text_raw: Use this piece to mark the locations on the other side. They are to be mirrored, so make sure they aren't in the same exact orientation.

lines.text: Determine which one is arm A and which is arm B by looking at the diagrams. Label them.
lines.text_raw: Determine which one is arm A and which is arm B by looking at the diagrams. Label them.

lines.text: On arm A, punch the following holes on the 6” side of the angle iron, measured from the left, each centered 1 3/4” from the long edge: Also, torch the hole for adjusting the rollers at 45". Its shape is shown in the diagrams.
lines.text_raw: On arm A, punch the following holes on the 6” side of the angle iron, measured from the left, each centered 1 3/4” from the long edge: Also, torch the hole for adjusting the rollers at 45". Its shape is shown in the diagrams.

lines.text: Five total 13/16” diameter holes at 9”, 13”, 18”, 28”, and 30" inches.
lines.text_raw: Five total 13/16” diameter holes at 9”, 13”, 18”, 28”, and 30" inches.

lines.text: Torch the roller adjustor hole in arm B, 45" from the right, so the holes will be at the same frame location.
lines.text_raw: Torch the roller adjustor hole in arm B, 45" from the right, so the holes will be at the same frame location.

guide.summary: Assembling the Primary Arms: the main component for connecting the center column of the CEB Press to its support system.
guide.title: Primary Arms
